Protocols/WebService.html#/c:@M@Swifty@o.name: serverURL
Protocols/WebService.html#/c:@M@Swifty@o.abstract: The Base URL of the server. Needs to have a scheme (http/https), and a URL.

Protocols/WebService.html#/c:@M@Swifty@o.name: networkInterface
Protocols/WebService.html#/c:@M@Swifty@o.abstract: The network interface this WebService will use to communicate with the network.

Protocols/WebService.html#/s:6Swifty10We.name: server
Protocols/WebService.html#/s:6Swifty10We.abstract: A BaseResource created from the server URL of the WebService

Protocols/WebService.html#/s:6Swifty10We.name: customResource(with:)
Protocols/WebService.html#/s:6Swifty10We.abstract: Can be used to have a custom base URL for a request, instead of the using the WebService’s Server URL

Protocols/WebServiceNetworkInterface.htm.name: loadResource(resource:completion:)
Protocols/WebServiceNetworkInterface.htm.abstract: Implement this method to tell a WebService what to do when .load() is called on it’s NetworkResource. The NetworkResource on which the .load() method is called comes in as an argument, and any networking library can be used to fire the resource’s internal request over the network, create a NetworkResponse from the actual response, and passed into the completion closure.

Protocols/ResponseInterceptor.html#/s:6S.name: intercept(response:)
Protocols/ResponseInterceptor.html#/s:6S.abstract: This method gives you the chance to modify the network response just before it returns back to the original caller.

Protocols/RequestInterceptor.html#/s:6Sw.name: intercept(resource:)
Protocols/RequestInterceptor.html#/s:6Sw.abstract: This method gives you the chance to modify the network resource just before it fires over the network.

Protocols/ResponseParser.html#/s:6Swifty.name: parse(response:)
Protocols/ResponseParser.html#/s:6Swifty.abstract: Custom Response parser need to implement this method. When done deserializing the NetworkResponse’s data, they have to set it to the NetworkResponse’s result variable.

Protocols/ResponseParser.html.name: ResponseParser
Protocols/ResponseParser.html.abstract: The protocol for creating a Response Parser

Protocols/RequestInterceptor.html.name: RequestInterceptor
Protocols/RequestInterceptor.html.abstract: Request Interceptors are called just before a request is about to fire over the network. Request Interceptors are called after all the constraints of a request a satisfied, but just before a request is about to go over the network. This makes them especially useful to add parameters to the requests they need to succeed.

Protocols/ResponseInterceptor.html.name: ResponseInterceptor
Protocols/ResponseInterceptor.html.abstract: Response Interceptors are called just before a response is going to be returned back to the caller.

Protocols/WebServiceNetworkInterface.htm.name: WebServiceNetworkInterface
Protocols/WebServiceNetworkInterface.htm.abstract: WebServiceNetworkInterface: A protocol which lets any object become a bridge between a webservice and the internet. Instances of Swifty conform to this protocol by default

Protocols/WebService.html.name: WebService
Protocols/WebService.html.abstract: WebService is a protocol which helps you write your network requests in a declarative, type-safe and expressive way.

Enums/URLSessionTaskPriority.html.name: URLSessionTaskPriority
Enums/URLSessionTaskPriority.html.abstract: An enum that encapsulates the values considered significant by URLSession for defining task priority.

Classes/BaseResource.html#/s:6Swifty12Ba.name: get(_:)
Classes/BaseResource.html#/s:6Swifty12Ba.abstract: Sets the HTTP Method of the request to GET and returns a NetworkResource.

Classes/BaseResource.html#/s:6Swifty12Ba.name: post(_:)
Classes/BaseResource.html#/s:6Swifty12Ba.abstract: Sets the HTTP Method of the request to POST and returns a NetworkResource.

Classes/BaseResource.html#/s:6Swifty12Ba.name: put(_:)
Classes/BaseResource.html#/s:6Swifty12Ba.abstract: Sets the HTTP Method of the request to PUT and returns a NetworkResource.

Classes/BaseResource.html#/s:6Swifty12Ba.name: delete(_:)
Classes/BaseResource.html#/s:6Swifty12Ba.abstract: Sets the HTTP Method of the request to DELETE and returns a NetworkResource.

Classes/Constraint.html#/s:6Swifty10Cons.name: isConstraintSatisfied(for:)
Classes/Constraint.html#/s:6Swifty10Cons.abstract: This method is called on your constraint for every resource (with canHaveConstraints = true) that passes through Swifty.

Classes/Constraint.html#/s:6Swifty10Cons.name: satisfyConstraint(for:)
Classes/Constraint.html#/s:6Swifty10Cons.abstract: This method is called asynchronously when the isConstraintSatisfied method returns false.

Classes/Constraint.html#/s:6Swifty10Cons.name: finish(with:)
Classes/Constraint.html#/s:6Swifty10Cons.abstract: Informs Swifty that the constraint has finished.

Classes/Swifty.html#/s:6SwiftyAAC6shared.name: shared
Classes/Swifty.html#/s:6SwiftyAAC6shared.abstract: Swifty’s shared instance: It’s highly recommended you create your own Swifty instances with your customizations (Constraints, Interceptors) instead of using the shared instance.

Classes/Swifty.html#/s:6SwiftyAACABSo10U.name: init(session:constraints:requestInterceptors:responseInterceptors:)
Classes/Swifty.html#/s:6SwiftyAACABSo10U.abstract: Initialize Swifty with the given URLSession, Constraints, and Request & Response Interceptors

Classes/Swifty.html#/s:6SwiftyAACABSo23U.name: init(configuration:constraints:requestInterceptors:responseInterceptors:)
Classes/Swifty.html#/s:6SwiftyAACABSo23U.abstract: Initialize Swifty with the given URLSessionConfiguration, Constraints, Request Interceptors & Response Interceptors

Classes/Swifty.html#/s:6SwiftyAAC3addyAA.name: add(_:successBlock:failureBlock:)
Classes/Swifty.html#/s:6SwiftyAAC3addyAA.abstract: Adds a network resource to run on the Swifty Queue.

Classes/Swifty.html#/c:@CM@Swifty@objc(c.name: loadResource(resource:completion:)
Classes/Swifty.html#/c:@CM@Swifty@objc(c.abstract: Conforms Swifty’s shared instance to the WebServiceNetworkInterface protocol, making it easy to use directly with a WebService.

Classes/NetworkResourceWithBody.html#/c:.name: header(key:value:)
Classes/NetworkResourceWithBody.html#/c:.abstract: Adds the given header to the resource, or updates it’s value if it already exists.

Classes/NetworkResourceWithBody.html#/c:.name: headers(_:)
Classes/NetworkResourceWithBody.html#/c:.abstract: Adds the given headers to the resource, and updates the value of the ones that already exist.

Classes/NetworkResourceWithBody.html#/c:.name: authorizationHeader(username:password:)
Classes/NetworkResourceWithBody.html#/c:.abstract: Adds the given credentials as a Basic HTTP Hidden Authorization Header into to the resource.

Classes/NetworkResourceWithBody.html#/c:.name: query(_:)
Classes/NetworkResourceWithBody.html#/c:.abstract: Encodes the given dictionary into URL Allowed query parameters and adds them to the resource’s URL

Classes/NetworkResourceWithBody.html#/c:.name: fields(_:)
Classes/NetworkResourceWithBody.html#/c:.abstract: Sets the HTTP Body of the resource with form encoded data

Classes/NetworkResourceWithBody.html#/c:.name: data(_:mimeType:)
Classes/NetworkResourceWithBody.html#/c:.abstract: Sets the HTTP Body of the resource to the given Data

Classes/NetworkResourceWithBody.html#/c:.name: jsonArray(array:options:)
Classes/NetworkResourceWithBody.html#/c:.abstract: Sets the HTTP Body as JSON Array

Classes/NetworkResourceWithBody.html#/c:.name: canHaveConstraints(_:)
Classes/NetworkResourceWithBody.html#/c:.abstract: Sets whether the request should wait for Constraints or not. false by default.

Classes/NetworkResourceWithBody.html#/c:.name: tag(_:)
Classes/NetworkResourceWithBody.html#/c:.abstract: Adds the given tag to the resource

Classes/NetworkResourceWithBody.html#/c:.name: tags(_:)
Classes/NetworkResourceWithBody.html#/c:.abstract: Adds the given tags to the resource

Classes/NetworkResourceWithBody.html#/c:.name: deliverOn(thread:)
Classes/NetworkResourceWithBody.html#/c:.abstract: Sets the Queue on which the response should be delivered on. By default, every response is delivered on the main queue.

Classes/NetworkResourceWithBody.html#/c:.name: contentType(_:)
Classes/NetworkResourceWithBody.html#/c:.abstract: Sets the Content-Type header of the resource.

Classes/NetworkResponse.html#/s:6Swifty1.name: data
Classes/NetworkResponse.html#/s:6Swifty1.abstract: The raw Data receieved from the network

Classes/NetworkResponse.html#/s:6Swifty1.name: parser
Classes/NetworkResponse.html#/s:6Swifty1.abstract: The ResponseParser that Swifty should use to serialize this repsonse

Classes/NetworkResponse.html#/s:6Swifty1.name: succeed(response:data:)
Classes/NetworkResponse.html#/s:6Swifty1.abstract: Forcefully succeeds the response, with the given response and data. This internally sets the error to nil. This is especially useful in response interceptors.

Classes/NetworkResponse.html#/s:6Swifty1.name: fail(error:)
Classes/NetworkResponse.html#/s:6Swifty1.abstract: Forcefully fails the response, with the given error. This is especially useful in response interceptors.

Classes/SwiftyInspector.html#/c:@M@Swift.name: shared
Classes/SwiftyInspector.html#/c:@M@Swift.abstract: The shared instance of the Swifty Inspector.

Classes/NetworkResource.html#/s:6Swifty1.name: request
Classes/NetworkResource.html#/s:6Swifty1.abstract: The actual NSMutableURLRequest this resource wraps over

Classes/NetworkResource.html#/s:6Swifty1.name: tags
Classes/NetworkResource.html#/s:6Swifty1.abstract: Tags allow you to categorize your requests, which helps you to recognize them in your interceptors and constraints to take selective action

Classes/NetworkResource.html#/s:6Swifty1.name: init(url:method:)
Classes/NetworkResource.html#/s:6Swifty1.abstract: Initializes the Network Resource with the given URL, and HTTP Method.

Classes/NetworkResource.html#/s:6Swifty1.name: init(request:networkInterface:)
Classes/NetworkResource.html#/s:6Swifty1.abstract: Initializes the NetworkResource with the given NSMutableURLRequest

Classes/NetworkResource.html#/s:6Swifty1.name: init(request:)
Classes/NetworkResource.html#/s:6Swifty1.abstract: Initializes the NetworkResource with the given URLRequest

Classes/NetworkResource.html#/c:@M@Swift.name: description
Classes/NetworkResource.html#/c:@M@Swift.abstract: The resource’s parameters in readable format, including the URL, Headers, Method, and the HTTP Body

Classes/NetworkResource.html#/s:6Swifty1.name: printDetails()
Classes/NetworkResource.html#/s:6Swifty1.abstract: Prints the resource’s parameters in readable format, including the URL, Headers, Method, and the HTTP Body

Classes/NetworkResource.html#/c:@CM@Swif.name: authorizationHeader(username:password:)
Classes/NetworkResource.html#/c:@CM@Swif.abstract: Adds the given credentials as a Basic HTTP Hidden Authorization Header into to the resource.

Classes/NetworkResource.html#/c:@CM@Swif.name: header(key:value:)
Classes/NetworkResource.html#/c:@CM@Swif.abstract: Adds the given header to the resource, or updates it’s value if it already exists.

Classes/NetworkResource.html#/c:@CM@Swif.name: headers(_:)
Classes/NetworkResource.html#/c:@CM@Swif.abstract: Adds the given headers to the resource, and updates the value of the ones that already exist.

Classes/NetworkResource.html#/c:@CM@Swif.name: query(_:)
Classes/NetworkResource.html#/c:@CM@Swif.abstract: Encodes the given dictionary into URL Allowed query parameters and adds them to the resource’s URL

Classes/NetworkResource.html#/c:@CM@Swif.name: canHaveConstraints(_:)
Classes/NetworkResource.html#/c:@CM@Swif.abstract: Sets whether the request should wait for Constraints or not. false by default.

Classes/NetworkResource.html#/s:6Swifty1.name: priority(_:)
Classes/NetworkResource.html#/s:6Swifty1.abstract: Sets the priority for the resource to be passed on to URLSession while excuting, defaults to normal priority (0.5)

Classes/NetworkResource.html#/c:@CM@Swif.name: tag(_:)
Classes/NetworkResource.html#/c:@CM@Swif.abstract: Adds the given tag to the resource

Classes/NetworkResource.html#/c:@CM@Swif.name: tags(_:)
Classes/NetworkResource.html#/c:@CM@Swif.abstract: Adds the given tags to the resource

Classes/NetworkResource.html#/c:@CM@Swif.name: deliverOn(thread:)
Classes/NetworkResource.html#/c:@CM@Swif.abstract: Sets the Queue on which the response should be delivered on. By default, every response is delivered on the main queue.

Classes/NetworkResource.html#/c:@CM@Swif.name: hasTag(_:)
Classes/NetworkResource.html#/c:@CM@Swif.abstract: Checks whether the resource has the given tag

Classes/NetworkResource.html#/c:@CM@Swif.name: contentType(_:)
Classes/NetworkResource.html#/c:@CM@Swif.abstract: Sets the Content-Type header of the resource.

Classes/NetworkResource.html#/c:@CM@Swif.name: load(completion:)
Classes/NetworkResource.html#/c:@CM@Swif.abstract: Loads the network resource, and calls the completion block with an unserialized NetworkResponse

Classes/NetworkResource.html#/c:@CM@Swif.name: load(successBlock:failureBlock:)
Classes/NetworkResource.html#/c:@CM@Swif.abstract: Loads the network resource, and calls the success block with unserialized Data and HTTPURLResponse or the failure block with the error

Classes/NetworkResource.html#/c:@CM@Swif.name: loadJSON(readingOptions:successBlock:failureBlock:)
Classes/NetworkResource.html#/c:@CM@Swif.abstract: Loads the network resource, and calls the successBlock with the parsed JSON, or the failure block with the error.

Classes/NetworkResource.html.name: NetworkResource
Classes/NetworkResource.html.abstract: A wrapper over NSMutableURLRequest, it’s an alias for a network request in Swifty.

Classes/WebServiceError.html.name: WebServiceError
Classes/WebServiceError.html.abstract: Errors that can occur in the WebService domain

Classes/SwiftyError.html.name: SwiftyError
Classes/SwiftyError.html.abstract: Errors that can occur in the Swifty domain

Classes/SwiftyInspector.html.name: SwiftyInspector
Classes/SwiftyInspector.html.abstract: Swifty Inspector is way to view the log of all requests that have gone through Swifty, and view their request and response parameters, including their URLSessionTaskMetrics.

Classes/NetworkResponse.html.name: NetworkResponse
Classes/NetworkResponse.html.abstract: The NetworkResponse class contains the Data, URLResponse, Error (if any) and possibly the serialized response for a given resource.

Classes/NetworkResourceWithBody.html.name: NetworkResourceWithBody
Classes/NetworkResourceWithBody.html.abstract: A subclass of NetworkResource, with support for carrying a request body.

Classes/Swifty.html.name: Swifty
Classes/Swifty.html.abstract: Swifty: The main entry point to the networking infrastructure. Keeps track of the constraints and interceptors and services the requests with it’s URLSession while taking care of all the attributes of the network resource.

Classes/Constraint.html.name: Constraint
Classes/Constraint.html.abstract: Constraint: Constraints are tasks which can hold network requests from starting until they are satisfied.

Classes/BaseResource.html.name: BaseResource
Classes/BaseResource.html.abstract: A wrapper over NSMutableURLRequest, only containing a request with the Server URL of the WebService

Typealiases.html.name: Type Aliases
Typealiases.html.abstract: The following type aliases are available globally.
